text: Mauritian Creole is a French-based creole language. It is spoken in Mauritius. It is not an official language but is well known among the Mauritian people. It is mostly French with a few non-French words. Mauritian Creole is spoken in over 65% of Mauritius. == References == Category:Languages of Africa Creole Category:Pidgins and creoles
title: Mauritian Creole
